othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to export beneficiary lines and program product data â€” selecting programs/sections, choosing export formats, and generating CSV output for downstream processing.

body.p: You can export all the beneficiary lines of your program or export beneficiary lines of a single section. You can download the beneficiary lines in the form of .csv. In the downloaded .csv file, you can view expression details saved within a section.
Exporting Beneficiary lines of an Entire Program
To export all the beneficiary lines of your program:

ol.li: Navigate to the Qualifications & Benefits tab of your program.

Click Manage Exports.
The export pop-up opens.

Click the file name to download, when the status changed to Completed.
You can view the downloaded file in .csv format. In the downloaded .csv file, you can view all the fields and columns available in the Qualifications and Benefits page and also you can view the column "Product Classification" to indicate whether each line maps to a qualification product or benefit product. You can view the start date and end date for the Qualifications & Benefits line in the section of the export file.

body.p: For programs with multiple sections, you can export the beneficiary lines of a specific section.
To export a section of the program, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Navigate to the Qualifications and Benefits tab of your program.
Click icon. The export pop-up opens.

Click the file name to download, when the status changed to Completed.
You can view the downloaded file in .csv format. In the downloaded .csv file, you can view all the fields and columns available in the Qualifications and Benefits page and also you can view the column "Product Classification" to indicate whether each line maps to a qualification product or benefit product.
